newsitem.title: USA: US stocks seen opening strong, Intel news cited.
newsitem.headline: US stocks seen opening strong, Intel news cited.

text.p: Wall Street stocks should open higher on Tuesday after Monday's record close, lifted higher by good news for Intel Corp, Philip Morris and Ford Motor Co.

"We could see a gap opening on the upside," said Peter Cardillo, director of research for Westfalia Investments, citing strength in the technology, consumer goods and auto sectors after the positive news.

Microprocessor giant Intel said after the market close on Monday it expected third quarter revenues to come in higher then expected, beating second-quarter revenues of $4.62 billion. The stock soared in after-hours trading.

"While the market looked tired in the final hours yesterday, the Intel news could revive the tech sector. It should be helpful for the whole industry, and lead to a firmer opening," said Prudential market analysts Larry Wachtel.

News that Ford reached a tentative contract with the United Auto Workers and that a Florida court threw out the bulk of claims in a Medicaid suit brought by the state against the tobacco industry should also boost stocks.
Philip Morris shares rose to 94-1/2 in London from its New York close of 92 overnight.
